DataElement.preferredName: Institution ECOG ACRIN Agreement And Approval Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions to ensure that the institution agrees to the ACRIN, ECOG-ACRIN imaging protocol and equipment qualification requirements and meets ACRIN, ECOG-ACRIN approval enabling patient and site participation in the imaging trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Healthcare Facility Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group American College of Radiology Imaging Network Agreement And Approval
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided._A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up._An infrastructure for multi-institutional clinical trials of imaging and related disciplines applied to cancer. The group has been in operation since March 1999. It does not have a continuing membership._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

Concepts.definition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

Property.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group American College of Radiology Imaging Network Agreement And Approval
Property.preferredDefinition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.:An infrastructure for multi-institutional clinical trials of imaging and related disciplines applied to cancer. The group has been in operation since March 1999. It does not have a continuing membership.:The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

Concepts.definition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.

Concepts.longName: American College of Radiology Imaging Network
Concepts.definition: An infrastructure for multi-institutional clinical trials of imaging and related disciplines applied to cancer. The group has been in operation since March 1999. It does not have a continuing membership.
The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the participant partaking
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the participant partaking in the trial at an institution which has agreed to perform the imaging research studies, completed the ACRIN or ECOG-ACRIN defined scanner qualification procedures and received ACRIN or ECOG-ACRIN approval?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI412
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient participating in the trial at an institution which has agreed to perform the imaging research studies, completed the ACRIN defined scanner qualification procedures and received ACRIN approval?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the participant partaking in the trial at an institution which has agreed to perform the imaging research studies, completed the ECOG-ACRIN defined scanner qualification procedures and received ECOG-ACRIN approval?
